metadata.title: CVE-2012-2768 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the topicadministration page in the RTFM extension 2.0.4 through 2.4.3 for BestPractical Solutions RT allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary webscript or HTML via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2768` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.0.6-3
rt4-apache2 - 4.0.6-3
rt4-clients - 4.0.6-3
rt4-db-mysql - 4.0.6-3
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.0.6-3
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.0.6-3
rt4-fcgi - 4.0.6-3
rt4-standalone - 4.0.6-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-3').
